cards.front: What are Newton's three laws of motion?
cards.back:
1. An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.
2. The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass (F = ma).
3. For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
hints: Consider the principle of inertia for the first law.
Think about force and mass relationship in the second law.
Reflect on interactions between two objects for the third law.

questions.stem: Which of Newton's laws states that an object at rest will stay at rest and an object in motion will remain in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an external force?
options: Newton's First Law of Motion (Law of Inertia)
questions.rationale: This question tests understanding of Newton's laws, specifically identifying the First Law of Motion which describes inertia.

insights.title: Application of Newton's Laws in Problem Solving
insights.takeaway: Understanding and applying Newton's laws of motion can simplify complex physics problems by providing a structured approach to analyze forces, acceleration, and motion. Focusing on real-world examples where these principles are applied can enhance comprehension and retention.

cards.front: What are the basic components of a machine learning system?
cards.back: The basic components of a machine learning system include data preprocessing, feature extraction, model training, and evaluation.

questions.stem: Which of the following is a type of machine learning algorithm?
questions.rationale: A Decision Tree is a widely used supervised learning algorithm for classification and regression tasks. It splits data into branches to make predictions, unlike HTML Parsing or SQL Querying which are related to web development and database management respectively, and File Encryption which pertains to cybersecurity.

insights.title: Understanding Core Concepts in Machine Learning
insights.takeaway: Machine learning revolves around developing algorithms that enable computers to learn from and make predictions or decisions based on data, emphasizing the importance of data preprocessing, model selection, and evaluation for effective algorithm performance.
